thread.title: Adorable French bulldog brings wedding rings to ceremony
thread.title_full: Adorable French bulldog brings wedding rings to ceremony

title: Adorable French bulldog brings wedding rings to ceremony
text: Share this article Share Moments later, best man Craig re-appears at the back of the wedding party with George on a lead to deliver the rings. The video has since been viewed on Facebook more than 7 million times. Bride Laura, 26, said: 'We showed it on a screen at the ceremony. 'Everybody thought it was brilliant. I think you can hear them laughing in the video. Only the best man and the maid of honour knew.' ... but where he arrives at the hotel realises he's not dressed for the occasion The heroic pet then runs back and the video shows him stepping into the shower before getting dressed up in his wedding outfit The pooch retraces his step and once again dashes across the sandy beach 'Everybody thinks the best man did it. Everyone's been saying what a great best man he is. It was actually me and James who thought of the idea.' Laura and James, who live in Stockport, Greater Manchester, come to St Ives in Cornwall twice a year on holiday and were desperate to get married here. Laura added: 'James proposed to me down there on the island. 'George was there too. He is like our child. We've had him two years. He goes everywhere with us. 'He had to be part of the wedding ceremony.' To fully execute their plan, the couple had to persuade the hotel to let them bring a dog to the ceremony. Moments later, best man Craig re-appears at the back of the wedding party with George on a lead to deliver the rings Bride Laura, 26, said: 'We showed it on a screen at the ceremony. 'Everybody thought it was brilliant. I think you can hear them laughing in the video. Only the best man and the maid of honour knew' 'George is like our child,' Laure said, 'We've had him two years. He goes everywhere with us. 'He had to be part of the wedding ceremony' And they then also had to persuade registrar David Murthwaite to let them show the video during the wedding. Murthwaite, who lives in St Ives, said: 'When the best man left the room, they then had a screen of George the dog. 'All the guests were able to watch that on the screen and at the end of the footage George came back in dressed up. 'I've never seen that before. It is always a privilege to be involved in anyone's wedding and that really made it quite special for them.' The video was created by friend Aaron Howell and videographer Kevin Creedon, of Plan 9 Wedding Video Productions in Carbis Bay. Laura put it up on Facebook on Tuesday evening and said she can not believe the attention it has had. She added: 'I can't believe it. I just put it up so everyone could see it. It started escalating from there.' Share or comment on this article Most watched News videos
